text: The J. W. Wood Building is a historic commercial building located at Lynchburg, Virginia. The commercial building in a modified Greek Revival- style. It was built between 1851 and 1853 as a warehouse.https://www.dhr.virginia.gov/historic-registers/118-0009/ It is the largest and best preserved of the few pre-Civil War commercial structures remaining in Lynchburg. and Accompanying photo It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1983. ==References== Category:Commercial buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Virginia Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1853 Category:Greek Revival architecture in Virginia Category:Buildings and structures in Lynchburg, Virginia Category:National Register of Historic Places in Lynchburg, Virginia
title: J. W. Wood Building
